question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

It is important to note that a temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution, as the Acting President is different from President under the Constitution.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

If fewer than 10 do so by that time, this question will resolve as No.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

Q.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be available in all EU member states by June 30, 2024?

P_given_Q.body:
This question resolves as YES if ChatGPT is accessible in all EU member states on June 30, 2024, and NO otherwise.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) A group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th? (b) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) Will a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time)? This could be by signing a letter or in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this resolves NO.

(b) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this resolves as No.

Q.title: Will any Democratic Party official publicly endorse a candidate other than Biden before July 20, 2024?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if any official of the Democratic Party publicly endorses a candidate for the 2024 Presidential election who is not Joe Biden, before July 20, 2024. If no such endorsement occurs, this question will resolve as No.

P_given_Q.title: Given that any Democratic Party official publicly endorses a candidate other than Biden before July 20, 2024, will either of the following occur: (a) A group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th? (b) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
P_given_Q.body:
This question combines two conditions: (1) The condition that any official of the Democratic Party publicly endorses a candidate for the 2024 Presidential election who is not Joe Biden, before July 20, 2024, which resolves as Yes if such an endorsement occurs, and No if it does not; and (2) will either a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to pressure Joe Biden to drop out before July 20th, or will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President? 

For part (a), this resolves as Yes if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators works together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign before July 20th, and No if this does not occur. 

For part (b), this resolves as Yes if Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024 that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President, and No if such an announcement is not made.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that no Democratic Party official publicly endorses a candidate other than Biden before July 20, 2024, will either of the following occur: (a) A group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th? (b) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
P_given_not_Q.body:
This question evaluates two scenarios under the condition that no official of the Democratic Party publicly endorses a candidate for the 2024 Presidential election who is not Joe Biden, before July 20, 2024. 

(a) Will a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time)? This could be by signing a letter or in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this resolves NO.

(b) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this resolves as No.

Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if the number of female candidates running for congressional seats under the Democratic party in 2024 exceeds the number running in 2022. If the number does not exceed, this question will resolve as No.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? [ahead of Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

"""

[image]The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

It will certainly play at more theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend

The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic). Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close. To clarify on resolution... this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release.

question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. question.title: Will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

P_given_Q.title: Given Joe Biden endorses another candidate for the Democratic nomination before July 15, 2024, will he announce that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
P_given_Q.body:
Will Joe Biden publicly endorse another candidate for the Democratic Party's nomination for President before July 15, 2024? If this is true, then will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. 

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024.  This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect.

It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government

If this condition is met, then the question resolves as Yes if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024. This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect.

It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given the UK government does not announce new proposals for Scottish devolution before May 3, 2024, will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?

This question will resolve as Yes if the UK government does not make an official announcement regarding new proposals for devolving powers to Scotland before May 3, 2024. Additionally, this question will resolve as Yes if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024. This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect.

It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

Will the  CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS)	
 be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

Q.body: This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be less than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

P_given_Q.title: Given the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) is lower Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, will it be higher Year-over-Year on the same date?
P_given_Q.body:
Suppose the following is true: The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) reported on July 20, 2024 is less than the reported number on July 20, 2023. Then will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) reported on July 20, 2024 be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023? 

Resolution criteria for P: The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be less than the reported number on July 20, 2023. 
Resolution criteria for Q: The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than or equal to the reported number on July 20, 2023 for P to be true. For Q to be true, the reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

Q.title: Will Ron DeSantis be a major contender for the Republican nomination for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if Ron DeSantis is considered one of the top candidates for the Republican nomination as determined by polling and media coverage leading up to the Republican National Convention. If he fails to be recognized as a major contender, this question will resolve as No.

P_given_Q.title: Given Ron DeSantis is a major contender for the Republican nomination, will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
P_given_Q.body: Suppose the following is true: Ron DeSantis is considered one of the top candidates for the Republican nomination as determined by polling and media coverage leading up to the Republican National Convention. This will resolve as Yes if Ron DeSantis is recognized as a major contender, and No if he fails to be recognized. Then, will Donald Trump be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will resolve as Yes if Donald Trump is selected as the nominee, and No if he is not selected. The outcome is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given Ron DeSantis is not a major contender, will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
P_given_not_Q.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if Ron DeSantis is not considered one of the top candidates for the Republican nomination as determined by polling and media coverage leading up to the Republican National Convention. If he is recognized as a major contender, this question will resolve as No. 

If Ron DeSantis is not a major contender, will Donald Trump be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will resolve as Yes if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as No. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

Q.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

P_given_Q.title: Given that Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 3 points on July 15, 2024, will his lead be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on the same date?
P_given_Q.body:
This question considers the scenario where Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 points on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. 

The resolution criteria for this question are as follows: 
- P: Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 3 points. 
- Q: Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points. 

If the condition (P) is true, then we ask if the outcome (Q) can also be true.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that Trump's lead over Biden is not greater than 3 points on July 15, 2024, will his lead be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points on that date?
P_given_not_Q.body:
This question considers the following: 

Suppose that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, is not greater than 3 points. Then, will Trump's lead be greater than 2 points and less than or equal to 3 points on that same date? 

Resolution criteria: 
- P resolves as Trump's lead over Biden is not greater than 3 points. 
- Q resolves as Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 points and less than or equal to 3 points on July 15, 2024.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count. Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count. Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

Q.body: This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than any other candidate according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. Q.title: Will a significant public health crisis affect Biden's approval ratings before August 2024?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if a significant public health crisis occurs that leads to a measurable decline in Biden's approval ratings according to reputable polling data before August 2024.

P_given_Q.title: Given a significant public health crisis affects Biden's approval ratings before August 2024, will both of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, and (b) 538 project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
P_given_Q.body: Suppose the following is true: A significant public health crisis occurs that leads to a measurable decline in Biden's approval ratings according to reputable polling data before August 2024. Then, will both of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, resolving YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time); and (b) 538 project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024, resolving YES if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that a significant public health crisis does not affect Biden's approval ratings before August 2024, will both of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, and (b) 538 project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
P_given_not_Q.body:
Suppose the following is true: A significant public health crisis occurs that does not lead to a measurable decline in Biden's approval ratings according to reputable polling data before August 2024. 

Then, will both of the following happen: 
(a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) 538 project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024: This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market. This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19. Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

question.title: Iran military response before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if, following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources.
